issues.title: Terraform backend: S3 bucket and DynamoDB locking
issues.body:
Create and configure the Terraform remote backend for the repo.

**Scope**
- Provision S3 bucket with versioning and server-side encryption
- Provision DynamoDB table for state locking
- Provide sample `backend.tf` configuration for envs/dev

**Acceptance Criteria**
- S3 bucket exists with versioning and KMS encryption
- DynamoDB table exists and used for `terraform init` locking
- `terraform init` succeeds against remote backend from `envs/dev`
- Outputs document backend usage and required IAM permissions

issues.title: VPC module: multi-AZ subnets, routing, IGW and NAT
issues.body:
Implement a reusable Terraform module to create the baseline VPC.

**Scope**
- VPC with CIDR configurable
- Public and private subnets across 3 AZs
- Internet Gateway, NAT Gateway(s) and route tables
- Outputs for subnet IDs, route tables, and VPC ID

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Module creates VPC, public/private subnets in 3 AZs
- Route tables and NAT/IGW are configured correctly
- Outputs exposed and validated via `terraform plan`
- Module documented with example usage

issues.title: VPC endpoints: S3, DynamoDB, SSM, ECR
issues.body:
Add VPC Endpoint support to the VPC module to ensure private access to AWS services.

**Scope**
- Interface/Gateway endpoints for S3, DynamoDB, SSM, and ECR
- Endpoint policies or SG rules restricting access

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Endpoints created and routable from private subnets
- Benches do not require public internet for these services
- Endpoints documented and their IDs output

issues.title: Security groups for bench hosts and EFS mount targets
issues.body:
Design and provision security groups to enforce least-privilege networking for compute and storage.

**Scope**
- SG for bench hosts allowing only required ingress (NFS from internal, SSM, internal app ports)
- SG for EFS mount targets restricting NFS to bench SG
- Document allowed ports and ownership

**Acceptance Criteria**
- No public ingress rules present for bench hosts
- EFS mount SG allows only NFS from bench hosts
- SG IDs output by module and referenced by compute/EFS modules

issues.title: IAM roles and policies for bench, orchestrator agent and logging
issues.body:
Create least-privilege IAM roles and policies required by bench instances and orchestrator agents.

**Scope**
- Instance role and instance profile for bench hosts
- Roles/policies scoped for S3, DynamoDB, EFS, SSM access
- Logging/CloudWatch permissions separated

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Roles created with policy documents (no wildcards)
- Role ARNs available as outputs
- Document policy boundaries and escalation path

issues.title: EFS module: shared workspace with KMS encryption
issues.body:
Provision EFS for shared workspace with multi-AZ mount targets and encryption.

**Scope**
- EFS file system with encryption using KMS
- Mount targets in private subnets for each AZ
- Security group and mountpoint outputs

**Acceptance Criteria**
- EFS created with KMS encryption enabled
- Mount targets provisioned in each private subnet
- Security group restricts NFS to bench hosts
- Mount target IDs and DNS mount point output

issues.title: Bench compute module: Launch Template, ASG, warm pool
issues.body:
Implement the bench compute module to create Launch Template and Auto Scaling Group with warm pool support.

**Scope**
- Launch template with user-data placeholders
- ASG configured with min, max, desired values
- Warm pool enabled for fast provisioning
- Required tags applied

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Launch template outputs ID and AMI reference
- ASG created and warm pool enabled
- Tag schema enforced on ASG and instances
- ASG scaling events visible in CloudWatch

issues.title: Bootstrap script or AMI: bench agent and EFS mount
issues.body:
Provide either a pre-baked AMI or a user-data bootstrap script to install bench agent and mount EFS.

**Scope**
- Script installs required packages, bench agent, and mounts EFS
- Writes minimal health/log markers for smoke tests

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Script parameterized and usable by Launch Template
- Verified ability to mount EFS and start agent (smoke logs)
- Documented configuration variables

issues.title: Module scaffolding and envs/dev root composition
issues.body:
Create the Terraform module layout and the `envs/dev` root configuration composing modules.

**Scope**
- `modules/` contains vpc, sg, iam, efs, asg, s3-backend
- `envs/dev` uses the modules with example variables

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Module folder structure present in repo
- `envs/dev` can run `terraform init` and `terraform plan` (backend configured)
- Module READMEs stubbed

issues.title: Tagging module and enforcement of standard tags
issues.body:
Implement a common tagging approach and enforce tags via module locals and policy checks.

**Scope**
- Centralized tag locals and helper module
- Ensure all modules consume tags input
- Integrate tag checks in CI (checkov)

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Tagging local exists and is referenced by modules
- Resources created in sprint include required tags (env, owner, service, cost-center)
- Checkov policy validates tags on PRs

issues.title: GitHub Actions workflow: Terraform fmt/validate/tflint/checkov on PR
issues.body:
Create a GitHub Actions workflow that validates Terraform changes on pull requests.

**Scope**
- Steps: terraform fmt, terraform validate, tflint, checkov
- Fail CI on formatting or security violations
- Post plan summary to PR (plan-only, no apply)

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Workflow runs on PRs and failures block merging
- Logs show results for each tool
- No secrets or long-lived keys required (use OIDC later)

issues.title: Enforce SSM Session Manager for instance access (no SSH)
issues.body:
Configure instance profiles and policies to enable SSM Session Manager and prevent SSH access.

**Scope**
- Attach SSM managed policy to bench instance role
- Security group and AMI/userdata ensure SSH port closed

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Instances can be accessed via SSM only
- No SSH keypairs created or used for bench instances
- Documentation for operator access via SSM

issues.title: Dev smoke test: launch instance, mount EFS, verify SSM connectivity
issues.body:
Perform a smoke test in the dev environment to validate core functionality.

**Scope**
- Trigger ASG to launch instance
- Verify EFS mount from instance
- Verify SSM session connection
- Verify DynamoDB read/write from instance with IAM role

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Instance in ASG reaches running state
- `df -h` shows EFS mount (or equivalent) in smoke logs
- Successful SSM session established
- DynamoDB write/read test succeeds

issues.title: ADR: EC2 vs EKS decision for bench compute
issues.body:
Document the decision rationale for choosing EC2 or EKS for bench compute in Sprint 3.

**Scope**
- Short ADR describing trade-offs, costs, operational complexity
- Recommendation for Sprint 3 (start with EC2) and migration path to EKS

**Acceptance Criteria**
- ADR committed under `ADRs/ADR-010.md`
- Team agrees and ADR references follow-up work for EKS evaluation

issues.title: Add CI security scans: Checkov and Trivy integration
issues.body:
Integrate Checkov for IaC scanning and Trivy for image scanning within the CI pipeline.

**Scope**
- Checkov runs against Terraform plan
- Trivy scan placeholder for future AMI/container images
- Block PRs on critical/high findings

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Checkov runs and reports on PRs
- Trivy step added (image scanning deferred if images not present)
- Critical findings fail CI, with remediation guidance in logs

issues.title: Provision private S3 buckets for artifacts and agent logs
issues.body:
Create encrypted, private S3 buckets for storing bench artifacts and agent logs with lifecycle rules.

**Scope**
- Create buckets with KMS encryption and versioning
- Lifecycle policies for retention/cost control
- Bucket policies restricting access to VPC endpoints and roles

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Buckets exist and are encrypted
- Lifecycle rules implemented (e.g., transitions to infrequent/GLACIER)
- Access policies restrict to bench roles and orchestrator

issues.title: Module READMEs and root README updates
issues.body:
Provide concise README files per module and update root README with sprint-specific notes.

**Scope**
- Each module README: purpose, inputs, outputs, example
- Root README: how to run dev env (backend init, plan)

**Acceptance Criteria**
- README exists for each module created in sprint
- Root README contains dev deploy steps and prerequisites
- Documentation is short, factual, and actionable

issues.title: Baseline smoke tests and validation scripts
issues.body:
Add simple automation/scripts to validate core infra (mount, SSM, DynamoDB access) for dev runs.

**Scope**
- Small scripts (bash/python) to run basic checks from bench instance
- Integration into CI as optional sanity step

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Scripts present in `tests/smoke/`
- Scripts can be run manually to validate bench functionality
- Documentation on how to execute the smoke tests
